channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned motor/scooter, 14th July
item.description:
This motorcycle/Scooter has been sitting outside a garage in Martin Dene which has constant access, it appears that it was stolen as the ignition has been tampered, however it was reported to the police, and it’s not the case. Your details were provided to deal with this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Martin Dene, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small fly tipped pile of wood bits, 14th July
item.description:
Some assorted wooden bits (furniture, skirting boards etc) dumped at the side of the road. Not blocking anything but it's been there a while. "About 200ft before the footbridge ahead of the cemetery as you go west on the A2." I am reporting for a elderly neighbour that spotted it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 951, East Rochester Way, Avery Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dump of fly-tipping outside of fire exit, 14th July
item.description:
Large dump fly-tipping of green waste, building materials etc. it is blocking the fire exit which would be a hazard if there was a fire. Please remove ASAP.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shoreditch High Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leak, 14th July
item.description:
On road from petrol garage air con units. This is now turned to slippery green moss and algae and leaking all over public paths. I nearly slipped today and I’m 8 months pregnant. It’s not acceptable. Can the council follow and get this sorted with the petrol garage. It’s been leaking for months and months and causing a danger to public n public paths.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Mottingham Road, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge mound of dumped rubbish, 14th July
item.description:
Huge mound of dumped rubbish. When is the council going to take proactive action on this and install cameras or actually prosecute people??!! Huge rats spotted, biohazard waste and children having to walk past this, as well as the poor people whose wall it is against. What is our council tax being spent on?!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Lane, Edmonton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
